home.title: Gmail OAuth Proxy Server
home.subtitle: A secure Google OAuth proxy service implemented with Go and Gin framework

dualAuth.title: Dual Authentication
dualAuth.description: Supports both API Key and IP whitelist authentication mechanisms

flexibleAuth.title: Flexible Authorization
flexibleAuth.description: Can use API Key and IP whitelist individually or in combination

httpsEnforcement.title: HTTPS Enforcement
httpsEnforcement.description: Forces HTTPS protocol (except in development environment)

ipWhitelist.title: IP Whitelist
ipWhitelist.description: Supports CIDR format and individual IP address access control

logSanitization.title: Log Sanitization
logSanitization.description: Automatically sanitizes sensitive information like tokens, secrets, etc.

requestProxy.title: Request Proxy
requestProxy.description: Converts JSON requests to form-urlencoded format and forwards to Google OAuth API

quickStart.title: Quick Start
quickStart.step1: Download the latest release for your platform
quickStart.step2: Set your API key (optional, auto-generated if not set)
quickStart.step3: Start the server with default configuration
quickStart.step4: Your OAuth proxy is ready to use!

header.title: Gmail OAuth Proxy Server
header.subtitle: Secure OAuth token exchange proxy service for Gmail API integration
header.description: A secure intermediary layer between your application and Google's OAuth endpoints, providing enhanced security through dual authentication and IP whitelisting.

dualAuth.title: Dual Authentication
dualAuth.description: API Key and IP whitelist authentication for enhanced security

httpsEnforcement.title: HTTPS Enforcement
httpsEnforcement.description: Secure communication enforced in production environments

ipWhitelist.title: IP Whitelist
ipWhitelist.description: CIDR format and individual IP control for access management

logSanitization.title: Log Sanitization
logSanitization.description: Automatic sensitive data protection in logs

overview.title: Overview
overview.description1: Gmail OAuth Proxy Server is a secure proxy service that facilitates OAuth token exchange for Gmail API integration. It provides a secure intermediary layer between your application and Google's OAuth endpoints, ensuring that sensitive OAuth credentials are never exposed to your end users.
overview.description2: The server acts as a secure bridge, handling the OAuth flow on behalf of your application while maintaining strict security controls through API key authentication and IP address whitelisting.

token.description: OAuth token exchange endpoint for Gmail API integration

health.description: Health check endpoint for monitoring and load balancers

authentication.title: Authentication
authentication.description: The server supports two authentication methods that can be used individually or in combination:

apiKey.title: 1. API Key Authentication
apiKey.note: The API key can be set via environment variable or auto-generated for development.

ipWhitelist.title: 2. IP Whitelist Authentication
ipWhitelist.description: Access control based on client IP address, supports:
ipWhitelist.note: Multiple IPs can be specified as comma-separated values.

authentication.securityNote: Security Note: For production use, it's recommended to use both authentication methods together for maximum security.

parameterEditor.title: Parameter Editor
parameterEditor.description: Configure your Gmail OAuth Proxy Server parameters visually and generate commands

howToUse.title: How to use
howToUse.description: Configure your server parameters on the left, and the generated commands will appear on the right. You can copy any of the generated outputs to use in your deployment.

form.title: Server Configuration
form.apiKeyPlaceholder: Enter your API key (optional, auto-generated if empty)
form.apiKeyHelper: API key will be automatically generated and stored in browser, click dice button to regenerate
form.ipWhitelistPlaceholder: Enter IP addresses or CIDR ranges, one per line

download.title: Download
download.description: Download pre-built binaries for your platform
